website_summaries.verdict: This toaster not only looks great and comes with numerous handy features, but it's by a top brand renowned for making exceptional kitchen appliances.
pros: In addition to the 7 shade settings, sturdy build, and 4 long, wide slots, this KitchenAid toaster stands out for its sleek, space-saving design and vivid red finish
Convenient "beep" indicates when toast is done
cons: A few owners wish it toasted a bit darker, but pushing it down a second time is an easy fix
Mixed reviews on how evenly it toasts

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment. I bought this toaster because I trusted the ...
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment. I bought this toaster because I trusted the KitchenAid brand. Boy was I let down. This toaster toasts every kind of bread incredibly uneven. I seems to get either untoasted toast or burnt edges and under toasted toast. Would not recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid let me down. . . twice with the same product
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to be a perfect solution. However, the toasting lever didn't work so I returned it. Thinking it was a one in a million problem, I purchased the same item. The lever worked once, then never again so it, too, will be returned and I will search for a toaster that functions. Size, appearance all as promised but a toaster that doesn't toast is not a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: kh

customer_reviews.title: It works and it looks great. No complaints
customer_reviews.text: This toaster looks great and works. It’s simple, doesn’t have a lot of fancy electronics and does what it’s supposed to do. The person who wrote the review with pictures complaining about the “plastic” pieces in the toaster that are a manufacturing mistake is badly mistaken. If he/she had taken the time to put in a call to customer service he/she would have learned that the pieces are silicon, do not burn or melt and are there to help the bread tray slide up and down. I can also verify that the product toasts bread evenly contrary to several other reviews here.
customer_reviews.author: Jack D

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, toasts poorly
customer_reviews.text: I thought that for the price that this should toast better. The outer edges of the toast burn before the middle gets toasty. No better than my old $30 toaster, probably worse.
customer_reviews.author: Geezerglide

customer_reviews.title: Consistently burns bread
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this toaster so much, that when the first one I ordered was consistently burning the bread on edges, I replaced it with exactly the same model, thinking I got a lemon, but the second one was behaving exactly the same way, so i had to return it... Looking for a better toaster now...
customer_reviews.author: Jul Nis

customer_reviews.title: Huge plug means less countersoace & dangerous
customer_reviews.text: It toasts okay when it gets it right. 3 is the highest you can go without burning. Front section more consistent than rear. Best feature: keep warm option Worst feature: #1 reason I will NOT buy this again is the dang plug. It is HUGE!! I wanted a long narrow toaster to gain back counter space but this giant plug sticks straight out off the wall. If your outlets are higher than the toaster you risk toasting/melting the plug. Any lower and your toaster hast to be 3-4" from the wall while in use to not be touching/melting the plug & cord. Kitchenaid: Please replace plug w a lower profile, wall-hugging, heatproof plug.
customer_reviews.author: NingNa

customer_reviews.title: Form over function
customer_reviews.text: This toaster works better as stilllife than as a small appliance. The polished chrome and brushed nickel, red enamel, sleek profile and minimal controls make this a stunning sight to wake up to. However, my delight in opening my appliance garage to this sight each day is soon deflated by limp, undercooked toast. The edges might get brown, but the center is always just warm. The picture I attached is of my toast this morning, burnt around the edges and untoasted in the middle, cooked on the next to darkest setting. (The darkest setting burns the edges black, yet still leaves the middle undone.) This product does not meet Kitchenaid’s reputation for functionality.
customer_reviews.author: jmamazon

customer_reviews.title: and it is loud and annoying. Seriously
customer_reviews.text: 1. The buzzer! The buzzer! Please turn off that damn buzzer at the end of the toast cycle! Why do you need it? You don't... and it is loud and annoying. Seriously, you put your toast in and one minute later you forgot all about it and need a freaking alarm?? I want to throw it out the window every time. 2. Hey, let's design a toaster so there is NO WAY anything will ever burn...yeah...and let's do that by making it so the longest cycle is NEVER enough toasting!! Yeah, that will make people happy....NOT! Ugh, seriously, KitchenAid, this is the best you can do??
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Massive; controls on two sides
customer_reviews.text: I did not pay attention to the measurements and when it arrived, my first thought was "it is massive". I think bigger than it needs to be. Controls on the side and end (bad idea) make using it inconvenient for my intended toaster location (-1 star). Either the controls are next to the fridge or they are accessible with the slider in the back. I have opted to keep it because it does a good job of toasting bread. My old one was much smaller but did not do a good job of toasting and could not handle slices of larger loaves. I have not used the special feature buttons and may never.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Petrosino

customer_reviews.title: regarding the burnt edges..
customer_reviews.text: I like the form factor and versatility of this unit (wide, long slots, manual lift). I see a lot of comments about burnt edges. After about 6 loaves, I see a pattern. All the store-bought bread that I've bought looks great. However all the home-made bread I've made (bread machine with packaged mix) tends to burn around the crust. Don't know why this is, different sugar composition, ???) So I use primarily bought bread, so only minus 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: dgh1

customer_reviews.title: it would be a great gift for someone you do not like
customer_reviews.text: it would be a great gift for someone you do not like. never toasts even. tops and sides over cook and bottom and center remain almost untouched. wish I would have kept my small toaster and flipped the long toast to get it to cook on both sides. sad sad sad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BREAD DOESN'T GET TOASTED
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this toaster several months ago. After many uses I cannot recommend it. Even on the highest setting, bread is barely toasted. It does accommodate the longer breads and they can be a bit thicker than a usual slice but not very much thicker. The crumb tray falls out every time we take it out of the cabinet to use the toaster. Fortunately I clean the toaster after every use. If I didn't, we would have crumbs all over the floor. In my opinion, this appliance is not worthy of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: drlisa90

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I paid a lot for what I thought was a toaster that would last. We’ve had it for two years and is almost impossible to use. The lever is extremely difficult, almost impossible, to push down. You have one job, toaster. I wish I would have bought a cheaper model.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Actually Toast on one side.
customer_reviews.text: I love this Toaster. It’s very sturdy and cooks my bagels great as well as anything else you want to toast. It has the one sided toast feature which actually works unlike most other toasters. This company is fabulous. I purchased a Mixer and the paint came off of the bread beater and a year later they replaced the entire toaster due to the beater attachment. I’m never buying anymore brands for all my kitchen appliances. From the smallest to a Refrigerator this is the best.
customer_reviews.author: BCDenny1

customer_reviews.title: KitchenFail
customer_reviews.text: I just returned the second unit. The first started OK for about 10 days. Then the toast started coming up darker on one side and barely toasted on the other. By the third week it was completely uneven. The "inside" burners were markedly darker than the "outside" burners. I figured that it being a Kitchen Aid, plus the fact that that I loved the design...I sent it back and ordered an identical unit. Hey, they make the best mixer so I figured let's give them another chance. The second one had the same problem. After two more weeks of completely uneven toast it went back. I have to say, Amazon's return procedure was flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful & controls on Front
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. We wore out the first after about 5 years, that’s a decent run for an appliance used multiple times daily. I bought a cheap one. Yes it works, it is in the cabinet in case we need tons of toast. I MISSED this toaster because this red is so beautiful AND because the controls are on the front. That is important depending on which direction you need to face it on your counter and I don’t recall seeing controls on the wide side. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nanny5550

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but not nice working :(
customer_reviews.text: I really am disappointed in this toaster. It is very hard to find the right setting for all the different kinds of bread I eat. On my homemade bread, it burns the very edges of the sides but doesn't toast at all on the rest of the slice. One time the cage in one of the slots came out of it's place and I had to figure out how to get it back in it's tracks. The best thing about this toaster is it's looks and the controls are all in the right places.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen P.

customer_reviews.title: Not a very good toaster
customer_reviews.text: It works, but does not toast evenly on both sides. The toast setting takes bread from not really toasted to burned, no in between. You have to manually try to watch and cancel to get a light brown toast. We are making it work but I would not purchase another one. Good thing we are not toast snobs. Smoke detector seems to be going off 50% of the time when we use this. I don't expect any of the other manufactures to be much better, hence why we just kept it. Past toasters from other manufactures have certainly been much better. This is the result of nothing being made in the good ole "USA" any more. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Eric, Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Should have listened to other reviews
customer_reviews.text: All the other reviews are right, this is crap. Toast is either not toasted or burnt. Half the time it doesn't work at all. You put the bread in and push the lever down and it doesn't stay down. You play with it for 5 minutes and give up. Its a KitchenAid - its supposed to be quality and its not. Should have spent $5 and got anything else. The only cool thing about it is that the slots will hold odd shaped bakery bread because they are extra wide and meant for 2 pieces of bread each. Doesn't matter if it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: Silicone is fine. Double heat is needed.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great totaster for long bread like we only use. There are silicone pieces inside like the reviews say. It’s not a manufacturing issue, it’s intentional so the metal touching doesn’t scrape and the tray rises smoothly. I don’t particularly like that there is silicone heating up every time I toast bread but they say it’s high heat rated silicone... so we shall see. Only issue I see is that the highest setting isn’t that high. So be prepared to do two heat baths on these bread boys. Also, do a few dry runs with no toast because it has to off gas a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts about a year
customer_reviews.text: This toaster, KitchenAid KMT4116OB 4 slice, arrived damaged. I sent it back and Amazon efficiently replaced with no hassle new one. Unfortunately, within a year of using the high lift lever/toast lift handle quit working. We could see it was a plastic part that had broken. I had expected a better product, as I own several KitchenAid appliances that have lasted for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi

customer_reviews.title: Pretty to look at but doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: Lovely design and features, very easy too use, but overall beyond disappointing performance. This is possibly the most uneven toaster I've ever had. The bottom half burns before the top half is even properly toasted, one side of the bread is always more toasted than the other. I wish I had returned it.
customer_reviews.author: UAM

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't toast even on each side. One side will burn and the other is not even toasted. This does not feel like a $100 toaster. Very cheap feeling, feels more like a $40 toaster. Bought a $174 Breville and it felt awesome but same issue but not as bad with cooking one side and not the other. The Breville at least felt like a good toaster. Both have been returned. How difficult is it to make a $100 plus toaster that feels and works correctly?!? We had a 10 year old 4 slice toaster that was more reliable than this.
customer_reviews.author: Korey

customer_reviews.title: It short circuited (sparks few in a short for no reason) after about a year
customer_reviews.text: One day the sparks flew. For no reason. Thought I'd have an electrical fire on my hands, but managed to pull the plug. After testing it later, a whole panel stopped working. This is after a year. I suspect faulty wiring. My pet peeve is appliances that don't last forever. I'd rather buy something great and keep it, than throw countless appliances into landfills. On the plus side, while it worked it was terrific. It also looks terrific. The red color is fantastic and brings a wondeful pop of color to the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Beware.  Can cause house fire
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Beware!!!’ Didn’t toast evenly ever.... and after nearly 2 years it developed a short in the ground wire and kept popping the circuit breaker. Tried it on another circuit and the toaster unit started to spark and sizzle. Could of been a house fire, but I was wary. Do not buy. Cheap crap!
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Kocher

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid KMT4116CU - toaster does not toast evenly
customer_reviews.text: I love the KitchenAid brand in general, but unfortunately this particular product didn't make the grade. It is a beautiful design and I would have loved for it to be sitting on my counter, but in the end I decided to return it (and also its replacement, after trying another one). My decision was based on the failure of basic functionality - neither slot in either of the 2 units toasted evenly. One side of the bread was golden-brown while the other side was still white. I tried 4 different toasting levels. Looking inside the slots at the coils, I could clearly see that heat wasn't evenly distributed between any of the 4 heating coils. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Drummond

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was a nice alternative to having a bulky, 4 slice toaster. I never spent this kind of money on a toaster, but decided to splurge since the silver option looked so nice and got decent ratings. The first time I wiped it, the lettering wore off. But much more importantly, it does a lousy, uneven job of toasting EVERYTHING. If I could have given zero stars, I would have. Never wrote a review before, but this is an expensive, terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work, trips GFI breakers every time
customer_reviews.text: Nice-looking toaster, but useless in our kitchen since it trips all of our GFI outlets. I can't imagine how a company can put out a product that pulls more amperage than a house built 1 1/2 years ago can handle. I saw this issue mentioned in some other reviews of this item ... should have taken heed. Hope some other folks will see this review and not waste their money and time just to have to return this, as I'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: SteveMcD

customer_reviews.title: Have to flip half way through and still baby sit it to get a good toast. With the exact same bread it will ...
customer_reviews.text: The center coils toast much faster than outer coils so that outside is almost raw but inside is almost burned. Have to flip half way through and still baby sit it to get a good toast. With the exact same bread it will burn one time and under toast the next on the same setting. Not consistent. Had to return. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi G.

customer_reviews.title: We thought KitchenAid would do better. That being said
customer_reviews.text: Produces uneven toast (dark on the edge and light in the center). A darker setting results in darker on the edges, and slightly darker in the center. We thought KitchenAid would do better. That being said, we haven't yet found a toaster that produces evenly-toasted toast that matches the darkness setting we've selected. With all the time toasters have been around, and with the new technology we have now, you'd think some manufacturer would have perfected one by now.
customer_reviews.author: Powell Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Not bad. Not great.
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of this, having the controls on the front (or side, depending on how you think) is good for our kitchen layout. Unfortunately, one of the lights on the options buttons doesn't work, but more importantly, this thing seems to take longer to make toast than most others. Note to Shark Tank: Can NOBODY invent a toaster that toasts using anything other than those skinny little flat ribbons of wire that wind in and out of the side panels?
customer_reviews.author: Shilo

customer_reviews.title: Not stellar, failed after 15 months.
customer_reviews.text: Toasts unevenly and takes forever. Great for bagels for some reason, much better than toast. It’s been okay but now, one side of one slot just stopped heating at all after 1 year and 3 months. Would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Up to Kitchenaid Caliber
customer_reviews.text: Why is it so difficult to find toaster that toasts both sides of the bread evenly?!? We've tried every setting, but you have to set it on 3, then flip sides when it comes up. I communicated with Kitchenaid about the issue - one side of the heating coils lights evening, the other does not. They thanked me for my input, but offered no solution. This one replaced a Cuisinart that would burn one side and leave the other soft. The next one I buy will be as cheap as I can find -- and probably work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: calf

customer_reviews.title: Toaster
customer_reviews.text: One thing to know is that the toaster is bigger than most. You could toast 4 pieces of bread or bagels easily. The only knock I have on the product, and this is true of so many toasters, is that if you put the bread through a second time, due to under toasting, it will char your toast. so, keep an eye on it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex P

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really make toast too well!
customer_reviews.text: Toaster is well-made, with a strong cord and good looks. It draws a lot of power, tripping circuits in the kitchen and toast comes out under cooked - even at higher setting. I ended up buying an older toaster from Goodwill for $5.00 that's easier to use, toasts better and doesn't trip my circuit breakers. If this heated longer, it would be great. It doesn't. Save your money. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this a couple of years ago. Right out of the box it toasted unevenly. We are not heavy users, maybe once or twice a month, so we were surprised when the front slot quit toasting one side at year one. We continued to use the back slot, but now the only way to get the toast slightly brown is to put it on the highest setting. Since it's only lightly used we expected it to last two years! Whatever happened to durability?
customer_reviews.author: Blue Feather Hollow

customer_reviews.title: Most uneven toaster I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Brand new toaster. Tried a couple of slices. Set the dial at "2" and one side of everything came out nearly black, and the other side came out barely toasted. Tried again, and got the same result. Definitely not worth the money. Returning it within one day.
customer_reviews.author: OysterMom

customer_reviews.title: $82.23 ? High price burnt toast from brand name JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: We have had many good kitchen aid products, THIS IS NOT ONE!! We bought 1 ea. 2 slice KA toaster (for gift) works fine, & 1ea. 4 slice long slot KA, this one burns black both ends while leaving the middle & bottom untoasted, settings 1-4 1/2 just warms the bread, 5-6 burns it. Wouldn't buy this toaster again, even for $1. Apparently KA has been aware of these problems four awhile, but prefer to keep selling this over priced bread killer. Another brand name company content with selling crap. This is with out a doubt the worst toaster my wife & I have ever seen. Try $2, at goodwill, you will probably get a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Tim barnhart

customer_reviews.title: Literally Huge
customer_reviews.text: This thing is literally huge. I couldn’t believe it when I pulled it out of the box. The slots are definitely long enough for big slices of bread. I had to send it back because it’s a laughably giant toaster. Check the dimensions of this guy before you buy it, then mark those dimensions on your counter so you’re sure you have enough space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy for looks - don't expect perfection
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's expensive and No, it doesn't do a great job all the time. The beep is louder than it prob should be and the heating elements do not heat evenly. All said: This is an attractive long slot toaster. Nothing is perfect - you're buying the brand and look. It's a shame the thing is so finicky. It does toast bread though.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Man

customer_reviews.title: A nice toaster and it looks better than the $14 toaster ...
customer_reviews.text: A nice toaster and it looks better than the $14 toaster I purchased from the drugstore 15 years ago. We like the fact that we can do four slices at once or long slices (that had to be cut in half for the old toaster). As some others commented though it does not always toast both sides at once but that doesn't bother us. Flip it around and let it go for another couple of seconds and it's good to go. We also like the fact that you can slide the toast up to see how it's toasting. I like a light toast and he likes it dark, dark brown. The reheat is also a good function.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Martin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t want to toast even if you beg it to!
customer_reviews.text: kitchenaid needs to stop making anything that isn’t a mixer and they seem to barely accomplish that. This is the 2nd toaster I’ve gone thru this year from them. This toaster in particular let me down because of one thing... even on the darkest setting, every everything I toast comes out white. I’ve never made it to the darkest setting on a toaster before and to have to push the lever a 2nd time is just dumb. Please stop making kitchen gadgets Kitchaid!
customer_reviews.author: JPEG

customer_reviews.title: Uneven toasting
customer_reviews.text: Our first batch of toasts were a mild disaster. Some of the coils didn't even heat up and the result was that the end of the toast was burned black and the middle was barely brown. In addition the middle section of coils are bent in a slight S curve which I think shouldn't be the case. And on top that the toaster makes a really loud, annoying beeping sound at the end of the toasting cycle which I couldn't find explained in the manual anywhere. Who thought that this is a good idea? So, this one's going back immediately.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bartels

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Bought this toaster in July 2018. Only two of us in the house, with an occasional guest or two. Worked fine for the first year, since then it's been downhill. Uneven, to untoasted parts of the same slice of bread. High setting barely gets it toasted anymore. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BLA

customer_reviews.title: I like my toaster
customer_reviews.text: I like my toaster, does the job like it should, my only complaint is that the whole top gets really hot, so just beware when touching it while/after its been on. I like how it beeps! Im one to start something and walk away and forget what I had going on, so its like a little reminder when Im making breakfast and go start getting my kids ready
customer_reviews.author: G&G

customer_reviews.title: Hate to say it but I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe that KitchenAid would make a product that works so poorly. The toast comes out very uneven. I found after much experimenting that the quality of the toast is better if I "preheat" the toaster by operating it empty 1 cycle to warm it up. I would not buy this again as I can get this kind of performance out of a $20.00 toaster instead of spending $100.00.
customer_reviews.author: vanferrian

customer_reviews.title: Nice toaster but has annoying warning beep
customer_reviews.text: The size is great and the style is beautiful for a toaster. Uneven toasting of long pieces of bread. Darker on the edges and light in the middle, but overall, it's a great toaster. The reason I left off a star is the annoying warning beep before the toast pops up. It's loud and annoying and I wish I there was a way to disable.
customer_reviews.author: Dotguy

customer_reviews.title: Uneven toasting
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older KitchenAid toaster with this model. There are few choices with long slots. That accounts for the fourth star. I would rate it lower on performance. Long slices burn on the ends. I had the same problem with the old toaster. Maybe a tiny company like KitchenAid can't afford the R&D to figure this out.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Kay

customer_reviews.title: What is wrong with the other reviewers?
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what the issue was with previous reviewers, but I found that this is a perfect toaster. Sure it smelled funky the first time I used it. Sure it will burn stuff easily if I double up on the toasting time. Beyond that, this does a really nice job. I have had it more than a month and probably used it 30-40 times now. It works like a charm. My only complaint (which I can easily live with) is the chime that sounds once the toasting is done. I would do without that feature KitchenAid
customer_reviews.author: David J

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, sturdy toaster.
customer_reviews.text: Good toaster so far; however, when heating frozen waffles, it usually takes me more than one time to get the preferred browning done, thus only 4 stars. Even at full strength it doesn't quite get browned enough from frozen. Love the color and the ability to lift to check on toast if desired, which I don't often do, but like that I can. It's handy for the 2nd time browning so I don't over-do it. Haven't used all the features yet like the bagel setting.
customer_reviews.author: R T

customer_reviews.title: Big Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have come to trust Kitchen Aid appliance. This item was not up to their quality. It never toasted evenly and now less than a year later it is only toasting one side of the bread. You can see In the toaster that the center heaters are much lighter than the outer ones. I have $20 toasters that are over 15 years old. This $99 toaster lasted less than a year. I expected better from Kitchen Aid. I would avoid this toaster.
customer_reviews.author: James Talkington

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and underperforming.
customer_reviews.text: I trusted the name and was fooled. It has been used less than one week and when cooking a single piece of toast in either slot, one side is cooked and the other 'raw'. Buy a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Really fast
customer_reviews.text: The fastest, most powerful toaster we have owned. Like the bagel function but you do have to squash them a bit to fit. A positive for this toaster is that the filaments run the full length of the long slots. I read reviews of others that complained of 2 piece filaments that left an un-toasted center in long bread slices.
customer_reviews.author: Louie52

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster
customer_reviews.text: We love this toaster. It has enough features to be useful but it does not take a PhD to operate. Great styling, toasts quickly and evenly. We like having toasts for everyone ready at the same time and also being able to toast larger pieces of bread -- not just traditional sized slices.
customer_reviews.author: W. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best toaster I've ever had. Fits two begals at once. The lift to check feature is great. 4.8 starts - Only knock is that the toasting is a little uneven at times. Having said that - this one is better than all the others I've tried. The lifting feature allows the user to move the toast around - safely- while it is toasting. Defrost and bagel buttons work well. It looks nice on the counter. Appears to be well made. No issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Barronlf

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Flimsy. Unpredictable toast setting. I will never buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: suzy

customer_reviews.title: The unhappy toaster
customer_reviews.text: I could blow torch better toast than this thing puts out. One side always cooks to lightly. Meaning the back and front AND left to right. All cooked differently no matter how I stick the toast in there. My parents have a single long toast of same brand. Never any issues. The coils need fixing badly in this model. Very unhappy
customer_reviews.author: danny

customer_reviews.title: This toaster is terrible! Does not toast evenly
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what other reviewers are talking about! This toaster is terrible! Does not toast evenly. Does not toast denser bread even on the highest setting. And is rather cheaply made. We bought this toaster based on other reviews, particularly when compared to the Breville which is similarly priced. We had a Breville which we liked but the center coil stopped working after only a couple of years and was not repairable. So we thought the Kitchenaid version might be a better choice. Wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Marion K.

customer_reviews.title: Does have light settings that work
customer_reviews.text: The toaster is inconsistent with browning. At times it toasts both sides evenly, and other times the sides are markedly different. But I like that it does have a light browning that actually is... light.
customer_reviews.author: Scrapbook Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Burns edges every time! And HUGE!!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this toaster has minimal plastic, has a great look but it is the worst toaster I’ve ever owned and most of mine have been cheap plastic ones. It toasts terrible, with the edges burning without the middle toasted at all. I use frozen bread so thought that was the problem so I started defrosting it first, still burns every time. Not the mention the size is extremely huge even for a 4 slice toaster. Looks great but that’s about it. Doesn’t do the intended job! Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bonnema

customer_reviews.title: Pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Would actually give it about 3 1/2 stars. From a size standpoint, good for the longer pieces of bread, such as sourdough. Very convenient feature. My one "complaint" I have about it is that it won't make toast very dark, even at the full darkness setting. I must toast the bread twice every time to achieve this. That applies to all types of bread I use.
customer_reviews.author: J.W.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This toaster doesn’t even brown the bread, u have to toast it twice in order for ur bread slice to be brown. Whats the point? It takes too long! Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Talia

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster and holds quite a bit
customer_reviews.text: Love having this toaster that holds 2 whole bagels or English muffins at once. Or 4 pieces of bread. We can eat at the same time! The toaster is great. I don't feel the outside of the toaster is unduly hot. I do have to increase the temp to a 4 or 5 for denser breads but other than that, its been great.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought a hamilton beech a few months ago and I didn't like it from the start because of uneven toasting but this kitchen aide works very well. Bagels work very well and the toast is browned on both sides although one side is a little more than the other. Nothing like the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Carl

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Toaster- Short Lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Appreciate the GREAT DESIGN of this Empire Red, KitchenAid 4-Slice, Long Slot toaster, which is perfect for artisan breads. Unfortunately, ours lasted only 3 years before the middle element stopped working. We ordered another one just to see if this was a fluke. Cautiously recommend. There are not many quality toasters on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Resilient Heart

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: It is a good looking toaster. Unfortunately, we are not happy with its performance. It doesn't toast in the center, but burns on the edges. It doesn't look like all of the filaments are working. It is quite pricey but if it had worked the way I hoped, I would have thought it worth the price since it had all of the design features I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Top Cat

customer_reviews.title: This Toaster is Toast
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years it barely toasts toast. So instead of toasting this toaster I must toss it for it cannot even at it utmost Tommy Train huff and puff highest bestest, blackest, burntest setting get close to toasting toast on one plop of the plugger.
customer_reviews.author: sjineug

customer_reviews.title: I like that the controls are on the front of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this about a week. The unit seems to toast well and fairly evenly. I've yet to burn anything, which wasn't the case with my old toaster. I like that the controls are on the front of the unit. But the body is a bit large and has an overall clunky design. I like to put baking trays on my toaster when I take something out of the oven and the top of the unit is slightly curved, making the surface uneven.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Looks amazing and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Love this slim line toaster that fits nicely against the wall, not taking up much counter space. Love the non-shiny stainless colored body that blends in nicely with my color scheme. Love the long slots for toasting long, round loaf slices. I did a lot of research to locate my perfect toaster at and I was not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alica

customer_reviews.title: Bing! Your toast is ready!
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, but who in the hell thought it was a good idea to have a loud alarm for when the toast toasted? Everyone in the house can hear it toast eeeaaarrrrlllyyy in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Red Hot Kitchen Aid Toaster
customer_reviews.text: This Kitchen Aid toaster is just the best. I like long slices of sourdough bread and they fit. Used to have to cut them in half. Also great for frozen bread or bagels. And the red is charming. Makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Justo

customer_reviews.title: Does not toast evenly.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one in June 2016, and have suffered ever since. Does not toast evenly, and isn’t even consistent. Sometimes it gets the edges, sometimes the tops and not the bottoms. Has not quit/died, much to my dismay. Will not try another one.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus E. Lower

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't toast......Listen to the reviews!!
customer_reviews.text: I am nit satisfied with this product. I normally don't listen to reviews, but, in this case, I should have. This toaster does not efficiently toast bread. It is either not toasted enough or toasted too much to the point of it almost being burnt. If it does toast, only one side of the bread is toasted. Although the design is nice and the name is trusted, it is not a good toaster especially for the price. All of the reviews said this and I wish I would have listened. Hopefully Amazon will take this product back and issue me a refund so that I can buy a product that works. I gave this an extra star for design.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas B.

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction – OK functioning as toaster
customer_reviews.text: Heavy construction. Very solid. Nice features as far as termination of cooking. Temper control only OK. Does not cook bread evenly – edges seem to burn before center cooks well. Have had same trouble with all toasters. Not sure worth spending the extra money if they all do the same somewhat spotty job.
customer_reviews.author: Andra Marino

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't toast evenly
customer_reviews.text: At a higher setting it will toast on one side of the bread and barely warms the other. When you put it on the highest setting it burns both sides. Really disappointing from a KitchenAid product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Walker

customer_reviews.title: 1 sided toaster
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed a much older Kitchenaid toaster for many years, so I thought I'd get another one to replace it. This new one only toasts one side of the bread. I've tried it several times to be sure it wasn't a fluke, but no luck. Back it goes. Too bad as it was a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Ltraveller

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but . . .
customer_reviews.text: Great design. Beautiful. Nice features such as only toasting a bagel on the cut side. However, when toasting bread on 2 sides, setting #2 toasts too little and setting #3 toasts too much. However, the company has written that they will replace it for me. Here's hoping the new one has a different control setting.
customer_reviews.author: B. Leete

customer_reviews.title: BEST TOASTER EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one BIG toaster! I ended up loving it. After many attempts to get the right toasting level I settled on settings 2 or 3 for toasting. It holds big buns and large sliced bread. It has a loud signal to tell you it is done. It does take up a lot of space but it's worth it. It is very good quality too. I feel I got a great price for a sturdy great looking appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Peg C

customer_reviews.title: Good, nice looking toaster!
customer_reviews.text: I use the highest setting and sometimes will toast things a bit longer. The keep warm button really means keep toasting, so be careful of that. It has a smell for the first couple of toasts. I just toasted with no bread three times and it was fine. The bagel setting works fine for me. I have a narrow piece of counter and this toaster fits there perfectly! All in all, this toaster looks great and toasts fine. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Paquipoo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't make toast.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this toaster because only the higest setting actually toasted the bread. The long slots were wonderful for getting odd shaped items in.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the high price.
customer_reviews.text: The wife insisted we get this because of the brand and color/design. As far as function, it primarily only toasts on one side. If you want both sides toasted and/or even, you literally need to turn the bread around for a second cycle, but at reduced time or you'll burn the first side. I've had $12 toasters do better jobs. Sure it looks great, but who cares, if it doesn't work right?
customer_reviews.author: Secret Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Diappointing, especially for the cost
customer_reviews.text: If the bread isn't just the right size the middle of long bread doesn't get toasted, then you have to start toasting again and pop up at the right time or it is now burnt toast!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Martin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't toast--which is a major drawback for a toaster
customer_reviews.text: I'm one who eats toasted something or others every day. I decided to try this toaster primarily due to name and cost. The only issue so far is that you have to cycle through this twice each time in order to get anything past warmed bread. Even the "dark" setting won't do anything other than warm unless bread is run through twice. Extremely disappointed in this product and am sorry i missed the return window for this--totally useless machine, strongly suggest you don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: David Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but toasts uneven
customer_reviews.text: We had a KitchenAid toaster for 20 years that finally gave out. We needed a new toaster that could handle bagels but was sleek enough to fit in a drawer. We hoped this one would be its replacement. The size was a bigger but still fit in the drawer, however the quality of the toast was not the same. If it were up to my husband we would send it back. But we are limited because of the size requirement.
customer_reviews.author: Dierdre Zimits

customer_reviews.title: Plastic bands are meant to be in the toaster
customer_reviews.text: The toaster works well. I especially like the defrost feature for my sourdough bread. I called Customer Service when I saw four plastic bands on the clips that lift the bread (others mentioned these bands). After talking with me, the service rep left me on hold while she checked elsewhere re the bands. The bands are supposed to be in the toaster and help with the process of lifting the bread, information I appreciated. There is no odor from the plastic bands.
customer_reviews.author: GrandmaA

customer_reviews.title: Uneven toasting
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a good toaster and was willing to pay more. This one seemed great and really loved the checking feature. But had two issues. One, at the highest setting it wouldn't toast. Always had to push it down a second time to get it to toast enough. But the deal breaker was the uneven toasting. Tried it over and over and it wouldn't toast evenly, so no matter the good features, its worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine Toaster, Some Un-even Toasting
customer_reviews.text: This toaster had super high-ratings on several sites. I think it's fine. But other members of the household feel it toasts un-evenly - not only unevenly on any one slice at a time, but also differently at the same settings at different times. It is sharp-looking; it fits lots of different kinds of breads, and we're keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Caromcg

customer_reviews.title: Above average design - But just average function
customer_reviews.text: Have had this about one month. REALLY like the design since it fits close to the wall, buttons and lever are convenient. And, I appreciate the ability to toast long slices from round loaves. But, I have to flip the bread to get both sides evenly toasted; I've tried thin slices and thick homemade slices and both seem to get toasted more on one side. I haven't tried the bagel setting yet.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne M. D.

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: It looks good on the counter. Simple clean design. Had to turn the dial almost all the way (6) to get brown toast. Appears to toast the outer edges first. I like the "keep warm" button because there are times that the kids aren't ready to eat when the toast is. I'll keep it because I already returned a different toaster and didn't want to go through the process again.
customer_reviews.author: dad2ccc

customer_reviews.title: toasts well
customer_reviews.text: toasts well. thought the bell that rings when the toast is done might be irritating, but it's fine. we needed a toaster with this long thin shape, and there are not many options. this one was good value for the money (assuming it'll last a bunch of years). another plus, this one doesn't drop crumbs everywhere like my other toaster.
customer_reviews.author: D. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Only toast one side correctly.
customer_reviews.text: One side comes out toasted and one side comes out white. I will post a video as soon as I get a chance. This is a big disappointment from a KitchenAid product.
customer_reviews.author: Vaspar

customer_reviews.title: It failed within a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: It started toasting on one side only after maybe three weeks or so, and quit working completely shortly thereafter. Bought a Breville locally instead, and like it a lot, other than the fact that the store only had it in white.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Moeller

customer_reviews.title: Just about perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is the next generation toaster to one I had for 15 years. Improvements have been made to a couple of minor issues so now it’s about perfect. Slots are wide enough for thick bread or bagel and long enough for sliced sour dough bread or two slices of regular size. Hope this one lasts as long as it’s big brother!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing..
customer_reviews.text: This was a big disappointment. It will not properly toast anything. I do not know if we received a defective unit or if they're all like this one but I expected a better product from KitchenAid.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Will not toast evenly nor enough at all.
customer_reviews.text: I’m confused. I’ve purchased Kitchen Aid products for my kitchen over the past thirty five years. The last toaster lasted fifteen years without a problem. Omg, this one toasts unevenly, burns my bagels and will not for the likes of me properly thaw and toast a frozen waffle. I can’t recommend this product and I love the brand. What’s happened is as I’ve said, completely confusing.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: The toaster has the ability to toast one side and ...
customer_reviews.text: The toaster has the ability to toast one side and only warm the other side. The idea is to toast a bagel that has been cut in half. However, the one received does this function only. I can not change it to toasting both sides at once. Very disappointing for a toaster at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Super toaster! We do muffins and bagels with speed and ease ... toast is a breeze and odd shaped pieces of sour dough bread, etc., are no longer a problem with the long and extra wide slots. The lift lever also is a clever solution to the problem of smaller pieces that once had to be stabbed at with a knife point or fork. We do, truly, love this appliance.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Young

customer_reviews.title: Not real powerful
customer_reviews.text: We like this toaster and it is a small footprint for a 4 slice. However, even on the highest setting you cannot adequately toast a bagel. We often have to put the bagels down a second time.
customer_reviews.author: OnlyRocnRoll

customer_reviews.title: No toast only burn
customer_reviews.text: Never write reviews. Seriously don’t buy this. There is no other way to say it, this toaster doesn’t toast, only burns. I didn’t believe the reviews that said so. I was wrong. How bad could a toaster be really? Well apparently it can get pretty bad. Like not toasting toast.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: This toaster works fine for us. Everyone likes how they can cancel the toasting with the button in the front. They also like the bagel feature. We will probably fine more things we like about it after we use it a while. We are wishing this one will last as long or longer than the previous KitchenAid toaster we had 10 years before wearing out. :)
customer_reviews.author: Martha A.

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KMT4116ER 4 Slice Long Slot Toaster with High Lift Lever, Empire Red
product_meta.description:
Color:Empire RedSave space on your counter with this 4-slice long slot toaster, and enjoy the versatility to toast just about any kind of bread, bagel and more. All with 7 Shade settings, including bagel, defrost, reheat and keep warm.

BRAND STORY
By KitchenAid
feature_bullets: Long Slot Design with Extra Wide 1.5 Inch Slots
High Lift Lever / Easy-to-Clean, Removable Crumb Tray
7 Shade Settings with Bagel, Defrost, Reheat and Keep Warm

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,504 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
